programme.title: Space Channel News Update | Deep Space Technologies
programme.desc: Back in 2006, to minimize competition, Boeing and North Grumman decided to form a joint venture for a period of time, realizing that they would no longer be bidding against each other for giant NASA contracts. This plan worked swimmingly until newcomers SpaceX arrived on the scene, and there was competition again. Duration: 1800

programme.title: Space Channel Movies- Its a dangerous universe!
programme.desc: The Boogies, SkyFighter and Caronte show that space is a dangerous place. Especially when it lands on the ground. Duration: 3600

programme.title: Space Channel Movies : Dark Star
programme.desc: In the mid-22nd century, mankind has begun to colonize interstellar space. Armed with artificially intelligent Thermostellar Triggering Devices, which can talk and reason, the scout ship Dark Star searches for "unstable planets" which might threaten future colonization. Twenty years into its mission, the Dark Star has aged and suffers frequent malfunctions. Commanding officer Powell has died in one such event, but remains aboard in cryogenic suspension. Lieutenant Doolittle, a former surfer from Malibu, has taken over as commander. The tedium of their work has driven the crew of Pinback, Boiler, and Talby "around the bend", so they have created distractions for themselves. Duration: 7200

programme.title: Latest News - Tide in Space
programme.desc: SpaceX sent Tide detergent to astronauts on the ISS so they can figure out how to do laundry for long-haul trips to Mars. Astronauts on the ISS received a shipment of items onboard a SpaceX spacecraft on Wednesday. The shipment included specially-developed laundry detergent made by Tide. Duration: 224

programme.title: UFO Congress update
programme.desc: The Pentagon has showcased declassified UFO-related videos and photos to Congress that included footage of a small object zipping past a military pilot as well as glowing triangles in the night sky. Duration: 175

programme.title: Helen Ramirez - On the Border of a New Frontier
programme.desc: Space Channel Crews caught up with Helen Ramirez (Brownsville’s Deputy City Manager) to discuss her efforts to build a wholistic space ecosystem in the Rio Grande Valley. From rockets to investment and communications, the City of Brownsville is leading the way as Texas becomes the epicenter for America’s new space economy. Duration: 277

programme.title: Silicon Valley of Space
programme.desc: The Silicon Valley of Space, quietly building a Gateway to Mars on the Texas/Mexico border. Duration: 150

programme.title: Trash Bags in Space

programme.title: NEWS | Starship and Polaris Program Update
programme.desc: Elon announced the Starship program may move to Cape Canaveral, and Jared Isaacman in tandem with SpaceX announced a new mission series named the Polaris Program. Duration: 350

programme.title: Latest News - Red Moon Rising
programme.desc: In 2021, it achieved an average of more than one launch per week for the first time in its orbital spaceflight history, making it the busiest year for its space program to date. We watched the country pass many milestones from successfully landing its first rover on Mars and test flying a hypersonic spaceplane to building the core module for its Tiangong space station and launching the first taikonauts onto the said module. Duration: 376

programme.title: Space Channel Interview with Frank White
programme.desc: Frank White has authored or coauthored numerous books on topics ranging from space exploration to climate change to artificial intelligence. His best-known work, The Overview Effect: Space Exploration and Human Evolution, is considered by many to be a seminal work in the field of space exploration. A film called "Overview," based largely on his work, has had nearly 8 million plays on Vimeo. Duration: 5400

programme.desc: An Alien Feature, featuring Aliens. Duration: 7200

programme.title: Space Channel Movie: First Man in Space

programme.title: Space Channel News Update- Space X, SLS and a Universe of Life
programme.desc: Updates on Space X and the SLS Wet Dress Rehearsal as well as a look back to stories we covered on UAPs, Mars and Alternative Universes. Duration: 1800

programme.title: Space Tourist-Maldives

programme.title: 2021: Space Channel's Year in Space
programme.desc: 2021 brought historic advances for mankind in space. From private space industry launching civilians into space, troubles on the ISS and China becoming a true space competitor, it has been amazing year to witness. And for the first time...there was Space Channel. Enjoy a look back at our coverage of launches, news and documentaries as well as movies, music and series. Duration: 14400
